pages.text: I will eventually need to build a workshop. I need a crafting table, to work smarter and not harder; until then, I can make a crude axe to get some planks. After that, I can easily saw wood using my crafting table.

Debarking comes first; with stripped logs, I can make planks, and with planks, I can make sticks if I need to. After, I should gather up loose rocks and sticks and combine it with my crude axe to make implements for my crafting table:
After, I can affix the crafting tools to the plank I just processed earlier, like so:
Ta-da! A fully fledged crafting table. With this, I can now more efficiently saw up planks from logs, at a rate of three planks per wood log:
Additionally, I can create more complex items with my larger and more sturdy workspace. I should also look into making a $(thing)portable crafting mat$(), great for crafting on the go:
Now, I should look at making some basic tools. A $(thing)pickaxe$(), a weapon like an $(thing)arming sword$(), a $(thing)shield$() and a $(thing)drying rack$() sound like a good place to start.
